comments: sigma(n) = A000203(n) is the sum of the divisors of n.Number of labeled regular octopi (or octopuses, cycles of ordered sets all the same size).Left edge of triangle in A008298.
references: F. Bergeron, G. Labelle and P. Leroux, Combinatorial Species and Tree-Like Structures, Camb. 1998, p. 56 (1.4.67).
L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 159, #10, A(n,1).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
Xiaojun Liu, Motohico Mulase, Adam Sorkin, Quantum curves for simple Hurwitz numbers of an arbitrary base curve, arXiv:1304.0015 [math.AG]
H. Ochiai, Counting functions for branched covers of elliptic curves and quasi-modular forms
formula: a(n) = Sum(d|n, n!/d). - _Amarnath Murthy_, Jul 24 2005a(p) = (p+1)*(p-1)! if p is a prime. - _Amarnath Murthy_, Jul 24 2005E.g.f.: log(f(x)), where f(x) = o.g.f. for partitions (A000041), Product(k=1..infinity, 1/(1-x^k)) - _N. J. A. Sloane_.E.g.f.: Sum(k>0, x^k/(k*(1-x^k))). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Mar 27 2005a(n) = A000142(n-1)*A000203(n). - _Omar E. Pol_, Feb 26 2014
maple: with(numtheory): a:=proc(n) local div: div:=divisors(n): n!*sum(1/div[j],j=1..tau(n)) end: seq(a(n),n=1..23); (Deutsch)
prog: (PARI) a(n)=(n-1)!*sigma(n) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 09 2014(Sage)A038048 = lambda n: factorial(n-1)*sigma(n,1)[A038048(n) for n in (1..20)] # _Peter Luschny_, Jan 19 2016
author: _Christian G. Bower_
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 12 2008 at the suggestion of _Joerg Arndt_.
